intro: Erysimum hesperis, commonly known as the California wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its bright yellow or orange flowers bloom in spring and are often used in gardens for their ornamental value. Erysimum hesperis is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
